result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole A Lavora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution for Victim A paid in full.
Costs paid in full. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations after 1 year from today's date. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence in 1 year from today's date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty. Priya Barnes.  
**forwarded to Circuit Court Business Center on 09-29-2022 (mjs)
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;  filed by Attorney Priya Barnes

Case called at 1:59 p.m.
Intern Nikole Kane in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Nicole A Lavora. 
Defendant Nicole A Lavora in court. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense requests expunction.  State does not object.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
Restitution:  $429.00 to Victim A
Fine:  $316.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in 90-days.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of  payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations after 1-year from today's date.
The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence in 1-year from today's date.
